intro: Alsodeia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered alsodea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Alsodeia pauciflora is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to harsh climatic conditions.
